oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Merle Travis interview - Biff Collie - KFOX
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Merle Travis (performer), conducted by Biff Collie for KFOX (Long Beach, Calif.), sometime in the 1960's.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie mentions how multi-faceted Merle Travis' career is -- Merle Travis talks about being from Mulenburg County, Kentucky -- Merle Travis talks about where his creative ideas for songwriting comes from -- Travis talks about being raised in a coal mining county -- Travis talks about recording No Vacancy on Capitol Records -- Travis talks about learning his guitar style from Mose Rager -- Travis talks about some of the more popular songs he has written, including Smoke Smoke Smoke That Cigarette for Tex Williams -- Travis talks about how popular his style of guitar playing has become among his peers -- Biff Collie wishes Merle Travis good luck and concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Travis, Merle, 1917-1983; Collie, Biff;
